book.synopsis: Plotinus is the greatest philosopher in the 700 year period between Aristotle and Augustine. He thought of himself as a disciple of Plato, but in his efforts to defend Platonism against Aristotelians, Stoics, and others, he actually produced a reinvigorated version of Platonism that later came to be known as
book.title_long: The Cambridge Companion to Plotinus (Cambridge Companions to Philosophy)
